works.complaint:
I am a permanent resident of Australia and hold  
Australian citizenship.

(a)	precisely listed below are the URL's of each offending web page linked  
to from the Google search results displayed on the Google website specified  
in (1) above;

(b)	the search query I used on Google to find the page was “Carly  
Crutchfield”

(c)	precisely listed below is the exact text and content that violates my  
rights under the applicable law; and

(d)	the reason I believe it violates my rights is because on each occasion  
the text and content listed below violates my rights because it contains  
allegedly defamatory material not permitted under the laws of the country  
in which I reside and hold citizenship, namely Australia.

The area of Australian law whereby I believe the text and content on these  
web pages violate my rights is pursuant to the Defamation Act 2005 (NSW)  
(“the Act”).

In Australia, defamation law differs from state to state. Because the  
postings were made on the web on the basis of section 11(2) and (3) of the  
Act, the laws in the State in which I reside apply, namely New South  
Wales.   Section 11(2) and (3) of the Act states:-

(2)	 If there is a multiple publication of matter in more than one  
Australian jurisdictional area, the substantive law applicable in the  
Australian jurisdictional area with which the harm occasioned by the  
publication as a whole has its closest connection must be applied in this  
jurisdiction to determine each cause of action for defamation based on the  
publication.

(3)	 In determining the Australian jurisdictional area with which the harm  
occasioned by a publication of matter has its closest connection, a court  
may take into account:

(a)	the place at the time of publication where the plaintiff was ordinarily  
resident or, in the case of a corporation that may assert a cause of action  
for defamation, the place where the corporation had its principal place of  
business at that time, and

(b) 	the extent of publication in each relevant Australian jurisdictional  
area, and

(c) 	the extent of harm sustained by the plaintiff in each relevant  
Australian jurisdictional area, and

(d) 	any other matter that the court considers relevant.

Based on the fact that the allegedly defamatory material has been published  
on the internet (ie. multiple jurisdictions), the applicable law is that of  
New South Wales as this is the area in which the harm occasioned by the  
publication as a whole has its closest connection.

In my view, the text and content that appears on the offending web pages  
listed below are allegedly defamatory of myself in accordance with section  
9(5) of the Act  which states:-

(5)	 Subsection (1) does not affect any cause of action for defamation that  
an individual associated with a corporation has in relation to the  
publication of defamatory matter about the individual even if the  
publication of the same matter also defames the corporation.


Below I provide you with further information in the hope that you will  
assist me with the removal of these damaging URLs that are in the web  
search "Carly Crutchfield".
